purpose: A React component library for creating accessible dialog/modal components using Radix UI primitives with custom styling

variables.name: Dialog
variables.purpose: Root component for the dialog system
variables.usage: Wraps all dialog-related components and manages dialog state

variables.name: DialogTrigger
variables.purpose: Button or element that opens the dialog
variables.usage: Wrapped component that triggers dialog visibility

variables.name: DialogPortal
variables.purpose: Renders dialog content in a React portal
variables.usage: Ensures dialog renders outside the DOM hierarchy for proper z-index stacking

variables.name: DialogClose
variables.usage: Can be used to create custom close buttons

variables.name: DialogOverlay
variables.usage: Provides visual separation and click-to-close functionality

variables.name: DialogContent
variables.usage: Contains the actual dialog content with animations and positioning

variables.name: DialogHeader
variables.usage: Provides consistent spacing and layout for dialog titles

variables.name: DialogFooter
variables.usage: Typically contains action buttons with responsive layout

variables.name: DialogTitle
variables.usage: Provides semantic heading with consistent styling

variables.name: DialogDescription
variables.usage: Provides additional context below the title with muted styling

key_points: Wraps Radix UI's dialog primitives with custom styling
Uses React.forwardRef for proper ref forwarding
Implements a complete dialog system with overlay, content, header, footer, title, and description components
Includes animations for open/close states using Tailwind CSS classes
Provides a close button with an X icon from lucide-react

patterns: Component composition pattern for flexible dialog construction
forwardRef pattern for proper ref handling in React
CSS-in-JS approach using className composition with cn utility
Accessibility-first design using Radix UI primitives
Tailwind CSS for styling with animation classes
displayName assignment for better debugging experience
issues: The close button is hardcoded inside DialogContent, which might limit customization options
Fixed max-width (max-w-lg) on DialogContent might not suit all use cases
No built-in support for different dialog sizes or variants
The z-index values (z-50) are hardcoded and might conflict with other UI elements
No error boundary or fallback UI for portal rendering failures
